website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy rack for larger magazines that provides you options in terms of mounting it.
pros: Easy to mount with two screws that slide along the back so you can target studs more easily
Open ends accommodate larger magazine sizes
cons: The screws that ship with this rack are not the highest quality, so you may wish to invest in your own

customer_reviews.title: Great design, great price, great solution for small spaces
customer_reviews.text: Great solution for storing paper recycling. I live in a condo where space, especially storage space is always at a premium. Desperate to increase the available floor space in my laundry room I searched for a solution for storing my weekly stack of newspaper/paper for recycling. The basket I've used for years (16"x19"x 9" high) was just the right size for stacking newspapers, but the footprint of the basket has always been annoying (see photo of rack vs basket). This rack is perfect! It holds newspapers, cardboard, and other paper flotsam/jetsam securely, yet the footprint is next to nothing! I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: SmartBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Rack for the paper bags!
customer_reviews.text: Some of us recycle paper bags from the grocery store for our cat litter disposal every day. Saving those bags and storing them can be a problem. I saw this magazine rack, and I decided it might work for paper bags too! Yes. We put it on on the wall by the little box, and bags are where we need them. It is wide and sturdy so it holds quite a few bags.
customer_reviews.author: Latin teacher

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 10-12 magazines .. Great quality and design for the cost
customer_reviews.text: I just got this magazine holder today and I can't tell you enough the quality of this product. It's beautiful, just like the picture and it's efficient.. I put it along side my tv stand and no longer have to clutter up the stand ;) The only thing I can say negative about this product is that you can't put more than say, 10-12 magazines in this without it looking just way bulky.. If you want to hold more magazines, I recommend going with a flat bottomed model.. Overall for me, this is a good product at a great price.. You won't be upset with the purchase..
customer_reviews.author: N.M.P118

customer_reviews.title: Well Made, Practical
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this magazine rack for my daughter for a Christmas present. I am very happy with the way it looks and the sturdiness of the rack. She is very happy. One practical aspect of the rack is that it is large and deep, but does not take up a lot of room from one side to the other...I guess it is longer than wide. This means it can be tucked into a small space and hold quite a bit of magazines and newspaper. The finish and the metal seem durable, there are floor protectors on the legs, and it is, in our opinion, an unbeatable value for the $13. price tag!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holding my kids' artwork
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to organize and hold my kids' artwork next to their craft table. I never want to throw their work away, but it can be tough to store! This rack fits perfectly next to our craft table and my kids can slip their completed work into it. Then, as we rotate which artwork is displayed on the walls, I can just grab stuff from their rack. It's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Carrie Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Stylish.
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be bigger. But that's my fault as the product dimensions and weight are clearly given. Still, Excellent. Stylish. Will hold a good number of newspapers, magazines, and even a few books right by my armchair. Can easily see what you want without having to pull things up and out as you would have to do with a closed magazine holder. No assembly required. Comes in a clear plastic bag. An abundance of cushioning brown paper made sure there would be no damage in transport.
customer_reviews.author: MDLION

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for quite some time now and they’re holding up great! Holds an average amount of magazines and hasn’t flexed/bent under pressure or anything and we have one of them pretty much completely full. A great minimalist design for a fully functional magazine holder. I bought two and if I had a use for more I would definitely buy these ones again.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: like cast iron
customer_reviews.text: This is heavy, like cast iron. But it's smooth and soft so it matches my wall organizers from Hobby Lobby. It's perfect for organizing my LSAT Prep books and my macbook above my desk. Getting the screws in right was kind of tricky because it is heavy so I taped it where I wanted it and held it for extra support so my husband could drill it in. It came with screw sleeve things so it doesn't fall out of the wall/stud. Well worth it. I would buy this exact item again if I needed more.
customer_reviews.author: Skeletor

customer_reviews.title: Love these for storage!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use as storage racks for kitchen racks, cutting boards etc because they are hard to store! These hold so many and I do love them! I was going to buy another one but they have doubled in price!!! Overall they are very well made!
customer_reviews.author: maria p.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I have this on the wall of my WC stall where it gets constant use: I'm an avid reader during 'sit downs'. This rack is sturdy, was easy to install and does exactly what it's supposed to do: hold newspapers and magazines. Only downside is that smaller mags like 'Prevention' need to be put in rack carefully since they can more easily fall out. Only reason rack didn't get 5 stars is because there was no color choice so I had to paint it to blend in with rest of my bathroom. Not a big issue so I'd give 4.5 Stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: NOCO Gal

customer_reviews.title: Art studio storage
customer_reviews.text: AWSOME.....I ordered this one day, the next day I already received. Nothing damaged or broken. I bought this for my art studio. I needed something to hold and store all my painting once they where dry and finished. I can fit about 10-14 1/2 inch canvas acrylic paintings I plan on getting one more for all my water color paintings as well, this would hold and store endless paintings. Easy to put up. Update....1/14/16. Still holding strong..on left side of my wall
customer_reviews.author: SportyTracy

customer_reviews.title: Works great to hold X-Ray jackets!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a doctor in private practice and I needed a way to organize x-ray jackets and files in my private office for patients going to different areas. I bought 4 of these and they work wonderfully for my 14"x17" x-ray jackets. I had looked at getting clear acrylic wall mounted file holders but they ranged between 60 and 100 bucks each on various medical supply websites! These were a little more than 10 bucks each and are no doubt more durable. Contrary to another review, these all came with screws for mounting which I screwed into a self-tapping drywall anchor and they are incredibly solid. These get 5 stars from me!
customer_reviews.author: Richard W. Blalock

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine here
customer_reviews.text: Installed 5 months ago Installation- Easy, but mine came with too short of screws, a little trip to the hardware store solved this problem, but since no one else stated this issue, I believe it was a fluke. Try to install in a stud to make it secure. Appearance- VERY NICE! Looks nice and holds 3-4 magazines or 2 books (approx) Held up great after using for almost a half year now. I see no problems in the future. I'm always cramming magazines into it, it's very sturdy. Thinking about putting in other bathrooms in the house. Priced right
customer_reviews.author: Jamie White

customer_reviews.title: Nice but wrong size
customer_reviews.text: This item was well made and nice looking. However, it did not fit in the small space that I have. Even though I measured, it was just too big. I had to return it. If the size had been right, I would give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: HappyinGA2

customer_reviews.title: Used it to Hold Extra Paper Bags
customer_reviews.text: Installed this in the under sink cabinet to hold the extra paper bags which we use as liners for the kitchen recycling bin. Sturdy and simple = perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Prime Mmbr

customer_reviews.title: Modern, Chic
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, simple, chic. This magazine holder definitely adds a chic modern touch to a room with being so simple. It could be used anywhere and fit in perfectly. It holds a good amount of magazines and because of the design of the holder, the magazines sit on both sides without touching each other. I love this holder and love how it looks in my house. It is light weight yet durable. It is perfect and I definitely recommend purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Mindy

customer_reviews.title: Works for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I use this rack to store matted I framed artworks in my studio. Just what I needed. Am not sure magazines or newspapers wouldn’t flop over if not totally full
customer_reviews.author: B B

customer_reviews.title: Modern and sleek magazine holder!
customer_reviews.text: Modern and cute magazine holder. Love the simplicity of the holder. It’s lightweight which is perfect when it’s filled with magazines - it’s easy to move around. Happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Szmr000

customer_reviews.title: Works great as a laptop wall mount
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy enough to hold my big gaming laptop or a decent amount of magazines ...holds real well and came with mounting hardware...was super easy to install
customer_reviews.author: Jess & Randy.

customer_reviews.title: It is sturdy however the legs needed to have some type of ...
customer_reviews.text: It is sturdy however the legs needed to have some type of plastic cover over them, that would have made is more quality; since with out it it leaves a black (faded) mark on tile and I would think it probably would leave a mark on wood floor as well when you move it around, so now I have it on a carpeted area of my home and it is tolerable.
customer_reviews.author: EG

customer_reviews.title: Attractive little wall rack with a bit of flair.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these-one for each bathroom. They do the job, keep the counters tidy while being decorative. They're slim, but one is currently holding a midsized paperback, our tiny local paper and two issues of Smithsonian. They're sturdy, were easy to hang and the price was right. I'm thinking of getting a couple for my kitchen cabinets to organize potholders and cookie sheets, or to use at work for file racks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It holds newspapers
customer_reviews.text: My husband works for a newspaper so we always have a lot of newspapers. This makes him keep them all in one place. It holds a good amount of newspapers.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great for Storing Paper Bags
customer_reviews.text: This magazine rack works perfectly for holding and storing grocery and other paper bags. I used to stack these bags on a shelf and they were a bit of a mess, always looking like the stack was about to topple. But mounting two of these racks on the wall has brought order to this resource. Each rack holds maybe 20 to 30 bags, depending on the size of the bags and how tightly they are stuffed into the rack. The open ends of the rack are a particular advantage, allowing it to accommodate bags of different sizes.
customer_reviews.author: jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Beware - Listed Product Dimensions Are Wrong
customer_reviews.text: I needed a magazine rack that was no more than about 6" deep to fit between my chair and the wall, and this one listed the dimensions as being 5.6" deep. However, it is actually 9" deep and does not fit my space. The other listed dimensions are OK. Other than that, it's a great magazine rack and would have been nice to have. Unfortunately I have to return it and can't give it more than 3 stars because of the incorrect size. If you don't care about that then this would be a nice magazine rack for you.
customer_reviews.author: C. Slasor

customer_reviews.title: Great for storing cutting boards!
customer_reviews.text: We mounted the rack on the end of our kitchen cabinets, just beside the sink. We have easy access to our four cutting boards, and they no longer take up counter space!
customer_reviews.author: sugargeorge

customer_reviews.title: Excellent construction, bad screws
customer_reviews.text: The rack itself is well constructed, functional, and blends well into its surroundings. I'm quite happy that I purchased it and it has served its purpose well. That said, I had some difficulty with the installation as the heads of both screws snapped off and had to be dug out of the wall with pliers. After switching to higher quality hardware though, it was installed in less than 5 minutes. Overall, I'd definitely recommend the purchase, but the shoddy screws are the reason it only gets four stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi

customer_reviews.title: Will fit ANY size magazine!
customer_reviews.text: The ends are open on this magazine rack, so it will fit ANY size magazine, even Rand McNally road atlases! Yes, the screws are included on the product label, but if you might want to use a different connector if attaching to surface other than wood. Not difficult! This is one of those rare products that, many years down the road when I have no use for it, will end up at a garage sale looking almost exactly as it did the day I purchased it; still functionally completely useable! (assuming we still have magazines or paper journals then!) --
customer_reviews.author: craigery

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a wall-mounted file holder that had simple, clean lines and was left open on the sides. I'm actually using this product in the kitchen at the house I'm renting; there's very little counter and cabinet space here, so I mounted this on the wall in order to store items like cutting boards, trays, etc. I checked out a lot of office supply stores before winding up here on Amazon, and this is perfect for what I needed, and at a very reasonable price!
customer_reviews.author: justginster

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These were perfect to hang on our pantry wall to out paper and reusable bags in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for craft supply storage.
customer_reviews.text: Using to store my craft supplies. Purchased two. One holds my large guillotine cutter. The other holds two Fiskars paper trimmers. So they are well well made & sturdy. Both are on the wall next to my craft table making for easy access. Very easy to hang.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Fits in well in any decor
customer_reviews.text: We subscribe to many magazines--this rack doesn't hold all of them "neatly"--the magazines seem to roll and overlap if the number reaches 5 or more--
customer_reviews.author: alaskafan

customer_reviews.title: Handy!
customer_reviews.text: I mounted one of these in the hallway, coming in from the garage. Now, instead of having our mail stacked on the kitchen bar counter, I have it in this handy little rack. When it begins to get full, I can sit down with a letter opener & go through everything at once; but in the meantime, I have no clutter. Also, for important items that need immediate attention (like bills), I can use one of the racks, leaving the other 2 for less important items.
customer_reviews.author: PCH

customer_reviews.title: Great wall rack
customer_reviews.text: I love this rack. I use it to hold my ipad next to my favorite seat. It would also be great for magazines etc. like it is designed. It is very sturdy and secured tightly to the wall. It is not bulky in design so it doesn't jump out at you when you walk into the room (it is functional but hardly noticeable.) The installation was very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri Mosier

customer_reviews.title: Low Profile, Big Impact..
customer_reviews.text: Love this magazine rack. It takes up very little room and is sturdy enough to hold several books. I had built up a tiny pile of photo albums under my coffee table, which didn't look bad, but seemed to be a bit cluttered to me, so I decided to get this very well-priced magazine rack and it was the perfect solution. It now sits beside my couch and even matches the legs of my coffee table. Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Great size for collecting newspapers & magazines
customer_reviews.text: Just what we wanted for collecting newspapers inside for weekly recycling in the big plastic containers outside -- not a box shape like our old container which our cat occasionally confused with a litter pan!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: This is a steal for the price. Perfect for my office papers.
customer_reviews.author: corona

customer_reviews.title: Great way to use an external keyboard with a laptop
customer_reviews.text: My laptop had some keys that weren't working, so I purchased this product so I could place the laptop on top of the long side & placed an external keyboard on the angled side. This allowed me to use a good keyboard and still see the screen fine. Perfect product!
customer_reviews.author: Yua Ca Van

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted to hold paper grocery bags to use for recycling!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I wanted to hold paper grocery bags to use for recycling!
customer_reviews.author: ReesInNJ

customer_reviews.title: Not for me, WAY too big...
customer_reviews.text: I found this magazine rack to be way too big for my needs. It is way larger than any magazine I have ever seen and about twice the size as my other magazine rack purchased from Amazon. (Spectrum Magazine/Newspaper Rack, Black) I can't speak for build quality as I returned it immediately after receiving it from Amazon. Of course, Amazon refunded my money promptly as usual. They do a great job at treating their customers right.
customer_reviews.author: studiotime

customer_reviews.title: Sleek & sturdy
customer_reviews.text: A surprisingly great buy. It’s sturdy and sleek looking. It doesn’t take up a lot of space. Fits great in our restroom
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Just what I have been looking for! And for some reason these are hard to find in my area. I found one at Staples but it was $28 and not nearly as nice as this one. I highly recommend this rack. Good job!
customer_reviews.author: scott a wallaceTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly for what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed to organize my binders at work. Holds well. My husband did use Sheetrock anchors with the screws.
customer_reviews.author: Chani

customer_reviews.title: Replacing the black wood screws.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this rack to attach to the side of the vanity in the restroom. It came with black wood screws so I went to local hardware store to get bolts, washers and lock nuts. They didn't have black bolts so I also purchased black caps for the bolt heads. Total of $8 but made the mounting look nice. I agree with another reviewer that having specific slots for the mounting screws would be a nice improvement, but happy with finished product. It holds more magazines then should ever accumulate in a restroom!
customer_reviews.author: Dwight Young

customer_reviews.title: A small/medium cutting board holder and drying rack too
customer_reviews.text: we have never used this for magazines, instead used it for holding cutting boards above the sink. We fixed it to the wall once, and currently use two of those suction hooks and hang it on the glass window over the sink, sitting on the windowsill. After using a cutting board, rinse and put it in there. It holds about three wood cutting boards for us, about 1 inch or so depth each. Works perfectly, lets them drain and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Deb Irene

customer_reviews.title: Great basic magazine holder
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice basic magazine holder. It would have been nice if it included some rubber washers for the screws but it was very inexpensive. (I used a couple of small pieces of cardboard to buffer the screw head against the metal. I'm using it mounted on the side of my desk at home to hold my laptop vertically so I don't have to take up desk space with it while it's connected to an external monitor and keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Gwench

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what i was looking for and wanted..i had asked a question about be able to use Command hooks to put it up with most said no it would not work ...WELL i'm here to tell you they do work the hooks i got were two in the package and hold 3lbs got them at walmart and they work just perfect....
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and decorative
customer_reviews.text: It’s sturdy, decorative, and fits perfectly in the area I wanted. It holds the magazines fine.
customer_reviews.author: Suzette Burns

customer_reviews.title: It works perfectly and keeps things nice and organized
customer_reviews.text: I mounted the wall rack to the inside of my storage closet to hold folded reusable bags. It works perfectly and keeps things nice and organized!
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Seville magazine holder
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made and can hold a few books as well. Does not scratch wooden floors. Easy to cary if not carrying too many books. Made mostly for magazines!
customer_reviews.author: Peachie

customer_reviews.title: I'm very happy with this magazine rack
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this magazine rack. I am using it to organize some coloring books of different sizes for my toddler. I wanted something to organize his books that was easy for him to see, grab and use and this was absolutely perfect. I have a 12x19 coloring book in there and looks great even though it sticks out. The quality of the rack is lightweight and well made. I would definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Used for garbage bags
customer_reviews.text: Really like this for our under the sink organization. We are holding paper grocery bags in them. They fit perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: cbelsh

customer_reviews.title: Magazine/Newspaper Rack, Black
customer_reviews.text: High quality for a reasonable price. Metal with matte black paint. Looks easy to repair if it ever needs new paint. This rack is designed to hold magazines in landscape orientation. As such the magazines will bend/curl in the rack. However, I discovered this rack will also hold magazines in portrait orientation as well. I think it actually works better that way. Overall, I can't complain. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: RTMIII

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I used this rack to store grocery store paper bags in my pantry. It’s just perfect!! Great sturdy construction and easy to hang on the wall. Holds many, many bags... currently 27 bags! Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Sunrise

customer_reviews.title: Great organizational tool
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect to organize my shopping bags in my closet
customer_reviews.author: Myrtle

customer_reviews.title: Passing the time on the throne
customer_reviews.text: Books to read while on the tiolet. Yah! Quick and easy to put up. Looks good too.
customer_reviews.author: william mcmillan

customer_reviews.title: Solid product
customer_reviews.text: A lot of the magazine racks I looked at at various stores/online were either too big or looked like wicker baskets. This one is a good size; small, yet it fits magazines perfectly. I have about 5 magazines in there, plus a 1" wide book, and there's still room for more. Black color, solid construction, doesn't look or feel flimsy at all, I have it in my bathroom, but it is really suitable for just about anywhere I think. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: newleaf

customer_reviews.title: Great for organization
customer_reviews.text: Gave a home to bills and other papers that would accumulate around the house. Could have been good installation (into stud) but MAN can this thing hold a lot! Had binders and large stacks on it at one point and it held everything easily. Used it for about a year before moving.
customer_reviews.author: Cara NormanTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Magazine Rack
customer_reviews.text: No assembly required, perfect for its intended use, hold magazines
customer_reviews.author: Martina Bowers

customer_reviews.title: I use it to hold paper bags from the grocery store
customer_reviews.text: I put it in my pantry so I can put paper bags in it, works like a charm!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: as suggested by another Amazon user and they work GREAT! They do come with drywall anchors and screws
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to use as organizers for collapsed paper shopping bags, as suggested by another Amazon user and they work GREAT! They do come with drywall anchors and screws, but I just put a couple of small nails in the wall and sat them on the nails. I purchased two and wish I had purchased more.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Jones-Wommack

customer_reviews.title: Great Magazine or Larger-Piece Mail Holder
customer_reviews.text: This magazine rack arrived quickly and in good condition. It's sturdy, of good quality, and easy to mount. My husband and I really like the scroll design - it's classy and modern without being too frilly. I'm actually using it in combination with a triple slot mail sorter to hold larger pieces of mail and magazines, and I'm ordering 2 more for other purposes around the house. Definitely recommend this if you're looking for something simple and decorative to hold magazines.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Office Breakroom
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for the break room at our office. It mounted very easily to the wall. It looks nice and keeps the counter and table free of clutter. The one issue I have is that the upward angle of the rack makes it difficult to read the spine of the magazine. Also, some magazines are so small they do not have a spine. It these instances you have to take the whole batch of magazines out to find the one you are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: S. Benefiel

customer_reviews.title: Quick ship
customer_reviews.text: Use this for all my religious books. I wish it was a little bit wider but it serves its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dinges

customer_reviews.title: Organizational solution for work files
customer_reviews.text: Bought approx. 20 of these 3 tier file folders & placed on large wall of office with labels beside each section. So easy to install. Stylish chrome finish is much more durable than plastic. These were a much needed solution. Wall of folders provides easy access to employees for jobs/work in progress files. See through design is a convenience & 3 tier size was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: donna b.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly strong with nice clean lines...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these racks and mounted them one above the other. Granted, we are subscribed to way too many magazines but these racks keep both short, small National Geographic and the larger, longer Wired magazines at hand in our home office. Installation was easy and it makes a big difference in the potential for messiness in our space.
customer_reviews.author: BAS

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and good looking
customer_reviews.text: ... and holds quite a few magazines neatly. I only wish the bottom of the 4 legs had a small rubber tip to protect my wood floor from being scratched; it would have added only about 3 or 4 cents to the cost of manufacture. But, it's well priced and looks great with my mid-century and Danish furniture.
customer_reviews.author: jc vt

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality for the Price!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Magazine / Newspaper Rack for my grandparents. They often keep magazines by their chair in the living room. This allows them to keep the magazine next the chair and clear off the space on the nightstand beside it. I was really impressed by the quality of the rack for the price I paid for it. I would definitely recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised. Hold more than magazines. I keep my cat brush there too.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Broken
customer_reviews.text: When I received the package, two of the metal feet were sticking out of the box, and when I opened it, one of the metal bars had broken off of the top bar and someone had obviously attempted to repair it unsuccessfully, so it was shipped to me broken.
customer_reviews.author: Aug1964

customer_reviews.title: Great but narrow.  I does hold several magazines.
customer_reviews.text: This looks great in my bathroom. My husband has his magazines everywhere so I bought this to keep them in one place. It is a little narrow. But you just have to keep the latest or best magazines and throw the others out. My husband needs a bigger (wider) rack. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Regina Mason

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these originally and then bought one more. They are easy to install and look and work great.
customer_reviews.author: Grandmama

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Use it all the time. And nice looking too.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Crabaugh

customer_reviews.title: Stunning!
customer_reviews.text: Such a great addition to the living room. Looks just as pictured, is well made and a lovely color. Would recommend to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Allie Ward

customer_reviews.title: Really pretty and doesn't stick out to far
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my bathroom. It is perfect to hold about 4-5 magazines and doesn't stick out too far and get in the way. Plus, it is really pretty and decorative. I am actually considering getting another two of them to hold towels rolled up on the wall next to the bathtub. I have an odd shaped bathroom and space is a premium. So this would allow me to store clean towels nearby.
customer_reviews.author: S. T.

customer_reviews.title: Great magazine rack!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! It's thick metal, is sturdy, came with good mounting equipment, and yep - you guessed it! It holds magazines! I bought this to mount behind the bathroom door so when friends came to the house, they wouldn't know my husband goes #2. Those pesky magazines laying around the bathroom are always a dead giveaway! ;-)
customer_reviews.author: JennM

customer_reviews.title: Good Buy!!
customer_reviews.text: They are sturdy and look great on our brick wall in the warehouse. We use them for job folders to keep everything organized. I just bought 6 more of them. Good buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: Hung this in our travel trailer using 3 5# Command hooks so it's easily removed for travel. This item is very well made and does a fine job of corralling magazines, newspapers, and paperback books.
customer_reviews.author: evl

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Use it to hold my BirdRock Bamboo lap desktop securely on the wall of our RV. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Ktazz

customer_reviews.title: Simple & versatile!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to put in our pantry to hold paper bags. It works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Summers

customer_reviews.title: It’s best for the floor.
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is great. The packing was questionable, thankfully it’s durable. I wish I had know how large this was though prior to ordering. I feel like the size should be emphasized. This is not a magazine holder for a stand. It’s for the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Linzee Edinger

customer_reviews.title: Space saver
customer_reviews.text: This magazine rack is easy enough to install and comes with a couple screws. Its design makes it low profile and perfect for limited spaces (like our bathroom). As with all magazine racks, the magazines tend to sag or slump to the bottom of the rack if they aren't substantial or if the rack isn't full. A solution is to stand the magazines upright. It easily holds 4 or 5 magazines.
customer_reviews.author: Mrspvmoore

customer_reviews.title: Fit my needs perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I love it and it's durable and easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Good product. It serves it's purpose and looks stylish ...
customer_reviews.text: Good product. It serves it's purpose and looks stylish next to the couch. If I didn't already have one of these, I'd buy one. If I had a friend who had a bunch of magazines scattered around the house, I'd buy it as a gift for him or her.
customer_reviews.author: J in FLA

customer_reviews.title: For magazines I'm sure it would serve a better purpose.
customer_reviews.text: Solidly built, heavy. Not exactly right for what I bought it for, which is 8x10 matted photos for an artisans market. They seem to get caught against each other when I have too many in there. For magazines I'm sure it would serve a better purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lemaitre

customer_reviews.title: Fits nicely in a small corner at the end of my ...
customer_reviews.text: Fits nicely in a small corner at the end of my couch / side table / wall. Currently have 10+ magazines piling up in there, and it holds them all well. No assembly, sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: itsapplered

customer_reviews.title: Holds reusable grocery bags
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for something to keep reusable grocery bags at hand. This holds about five.
customer_reviews.author: jbaje

customer_reviews.title: I can easily fit small works and up to 2X3 items backed ...
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several of these now and use them as art racks. I can easily fit small works and up to 2X3 items backed with foamcore and sleeved. PLUS these racks fold flat which is supper awesome if you need travel with them to a show.
customer_reviews.author: KFH

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Works fine for the tight space I had available. A bit pricer for what it is.. just wire.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have been trying to find something to hold my ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been trying to find something to hold my paper grocery sacks/bags and came across this. I have it mounted on the wall in our laundry room/pantry and it is working perfectly. This is much sturdier than the racks made for paper sacks.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hart

customer_reviews.title: Versatile
customer_reviews.text: I don’t use this for magazines. I put it on a butcher block and it holds all of my cutting boards! Great versatility with the open sides.
customer_reviews.author: Manjari D.

customer_reviews.title: Clean lines, lightweight, quick delivery
customer_reviews.text: Very nice magazine rack. I bought a second one because the first one seemed like good quality. I like the clean lines. It's lightweight, so easy to push aside with your foot when you want to vacuum under it. Arrived quickly too
customer_reviews.author: CGXTerra

customer_reviews.title: so guests get in and out and not too comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: It holds all of my statistics publications in my guest bathroom, so guests get in and out and not too comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Orion

customer_reviews.title: This is sturdy and can hold things as small as a greeting ...
customer_reviews.text: This is sturdy and can hold things as small as a greeting card to as large as a magazine. It was easy to hang and hasn't gotten loose in the long period of time we've had it. Not that it's around water or anything, but it hasn't even done any rusting or flaking like some things do.
customer_reviews.author: ShanaJustin

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: Just received and one of the “legs” is broken. Will return and I hope it will go smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love These!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these! I even had to go back and order more. Right now I am not only using them to hold my magazines but to keep track of my work load at my standing desk. My husband had no problem installing them; I would say it took just a couple minutes per rack.
customer_reviews.author: J. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Stylish
customer_reviews.text: I practice guitar in our living room and use this to keep a few music books organized. It looks nice enough to leave there all the time and certainly better then a pile of books and sheet music. It's not huge, but I bet I could jam in seven to ten typical magazines before it would look overstuffed.
customer_reviews.author: bennettlo

customer_reviews.title: Really BIG magazine rack.
customer_reviews.text: Its really bigger than I thought, huge, but it works. If you're putting it in a small space, it really opens wide.
customer_reviews.author: Arty B

customer_reviews.title: Neat and compact Rack
customer_reviews.text: This rack is exactly what I was looking for. Many newspaper racks are large and bulky. I have a small living room and wanted something to place magazines in without taking up a lot of room. This rack sits nicely next to an end table and keeps magazines in order nicely. I also like that it is open on both ends so that extra large magazines can fit into the rack. ...glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: Pretty design
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality and was easy to install. Flexible front so you can squeeze a bunch in if you wanted to. Comes with screws.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn R.

customer_reviews.title: Minimal, but strong
customer_reviews.text: I needed a place to organize bills, etc. in our tiny house so the piles of paper everywhere didn't overwhelm our small space. Hung this up right near the front door with the 2 included screws and it works great! Appears sturdy enough to hold magazines and more. Might get a second one to hold bathroom reading material.
customer_reviews.author: preciousROY

product_meta.title: Spectrum Diversified Wall Mount Magazine Rack, Wall-Mounted Magazine Storage, Home Office Décor & Storage Basket, Magazine Holder & Newspaper Organizer
product_meta.description: Style Name:Spectrum Magazine RackKeep your home and office organized with the Wall Mount Wire Magazine Rack & Newspaper Caddy. This slim rack conveniently stores all of your standard size magazines and periodicals. Organizer stores magazines, newspapers, periodicals, catalogs, or records. Artist may find the rack organizer helpful while selling prints or paintings as the evenly spaced slats allow buyers to see the artwork inside. The wires along the edges are thoughtfully spaced; they are wide enough apart that you can easily see between them, yet close enough together that nothing is at risk of falling through the bars. The minimalist design blends seamlessly into an elegant, modern room. The sleek, smooth lines and matte black finish add sophistication and style without taking up too much visual space. The high-quality finish on the organizer prevents scratches and chips. The smooth welds and superior finish protect your stashed items, so there are no jagged edges or rough ends that could damage your periodicals. The clean and simple design of this magazine organizer will add a modern touch to your home. Made of sturdy steel.
feature_bullets: CHIC, ELEGANT STORAGE: The minimalist design blends seamlessly into an elegant, modern room. The sleek, smooth lines and matte black finish add sophistication and style without taking up too much visual space.

SMOOTH WELDS & SMART DESIGN: The high-quality finish on the organizer prevents scratches and chips. The smooth welds and superior finish protect your stashed items, so there are no jagged edges or rough ends that could damage your periodicals.

MULTI-FUNCTIONAL ORGANIZATION: Organizer stores magazines, newspapers, periodicals, catalogs, or records. Artist may find the rack organizer helpful while selling prints or paintings as the evenly spaced slats allow buyers to see the artwork inside.

EVENLY SPACED WIRES FOR SECURE STORAGE: The wires along the edges are thoughtfully spaced; they are wide enough apart that you can easily see between them, yet close enough together that nothing is at risk of falling through the bars.
DIMENSIONS & CARE: 12" L X 4.5" W X 10.75" H; to clean, wipe with a damp cloth and towel dry. Self-Service is not pulling info through to the PDP
